ramakrishna also believed that the divine could manifest in various ways, depending on the person's cultural or religious background. therefore, he respected and valued all religious traditions, emphasizing that they all contained some truth about the divine.

additionally, ramakrishna believed that the divine was personal and could be experienced in a personal way, such as a loving relationship. he often imagined himself as a mother, lover, or friend of the divine, which allowed him to experience a deep connection with the divine.
